channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Remembering salsa legend Willie Colon
item.description: Salsa legend, Willie Colon, has died at age 75. Colon was a key part of salsa's development in the 1970's as an instrumentalist, songwriter and producer.
item.content:encoded: Salsa legend, Willie Colon, has died at age 75. Colon was a key part of salsa's development in the 1970's as an instrumentalist, songwriter and producer.
item.dc:creator: Felix Contreras

item.title: Europe reacts to new tariffs announcement and more uncertainty
item.description: President Trump announced a 15% increase on tariffs across the board. Europeans have been celebrating yesterday's SCOTUS decision, but have been doing so quietly.
item.content:encoded: President Trump announced a 15% increase on tariffs across the board. Europeans have been celebrating yesterday's SCOTUS decision, but have been doing so quietly.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Hidden Levels podcast explains how the industry has grown from the arcade into a global juggernaut
item.description: Last year, the video game industry generated around $190 BILLION in revenue. More than the music and film industry combined. How did this medium go from the arcade into a global juggernaut? That's the subject of a new podcast series called Hidden Levels.
item.content:encoded: Last year, the video game industry generated around $190 BILLION in revenue. More than the music and film industry combined. How did this medium go from the arcade into a global juggernaut? That's the subject of a new podcast series called Hidden Levels.
item.dc:creator: Mallory Yu

item.title: 'All Norwegians are born with skis on their feet,' Norwegian reporter explains her country's dominance at the Olympics
item.description: At this year's Winter Olympics, one country has dominated: Norway. Sara Sivertsen Fahrendorff, a sports journalist based in Oslo, discusses how Norway's culture plays a role in its sporting success.
item.content:encoded: At this year's Winter Olympics, one country has dominated: Norway. Sara Sivertsen Fahrendorff, a sports journalist based in Oslo, discusses how Norway's culture plays a role in its sporting success.
item.dc:creator: Emily Kwong

item.title: 'I witnessed him call America to live up to its ideals,' Sen. Raphael Warnock on Jesse Jackson and America's voting rights
item.description: Senator Raphael Warnock talks about the legacy of the Jesse Jackson.
item.content:encoded: Senator Raphael Warnock talks about the legacy of the Jesse Jackson.
item.dc:creator: Kai McNamee

item.title: Jubilation in Lahore with return of historic kite festival
item.description: The Pakistani city of Lahore celebrated the revival of a historic kite festival called Basant last weekend, 19 years after kite flying there was deemed too dangerous and banned.
item.content:encoded: The Pakistani city of Lahore celebrated the revival of a historic kite festival called Basant last weekend, 19 years after kite flying there was deemed too dangerous and banned.
item.dc:creator: Betsy Joles

item.title: How NPR reporters built an archive to document January 6th
item.description: Five years ago, a mob stormed the U.S. Capitol with the goal of stopping the certification of the presidential election. NPR's Tom Dreisbach wanted to preserve a record of the moments before, during, and after the attacks for future generations.
item.content:encoded: Five years ago, a mob stormed the U.S. Capitol with the goal of stopping the certification of the presidential election. NPR's Tom Dreisbach wanted to preserve a record of the moments before, during, and after the attacks for future generations.
item.dc:creator: Barrie Hardymon

item.title: 'Given a gun and sent to die': Kenyans lured to fight for Russia in Ukraine
item.description: Kenya's intelligence service warns that over 1,000 citizens may have been recruited to fight for Russia in Ukraine, many under false pretenses.
item.content:encoded:
Kenya's intelligence service warns that over 1,000 citizens may have been recruited to fight for Russia in Ukraine, many under false pretenses.

(Image credit: Simon Maina)
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Igunza

item.title: Why Alisa Liu's figure skating performance stood out
item.description: Figure skater Alysa Liu made a gold-winning comeback. She shared her new outlook on skating.
item.content:encoded: Figure skater Alysa Liu made a gold-winning comeback. She shared her new outlook on skating.
item.dc:creator: Gabriel J. SÃ¡nchez

item.title: SkiMo, the Winter Olympics' newest sport, takes the stage in Italy
item.description: The sport of ski mountaineering is new to the Winter Olympics this year but its origins go back more than a century in the Alps.
item.content:encoded: The sport of ski mountaineering is new to the Winter Olympics this year but its origins go back more than a century in the Alps.
item.dc:creator: Kirk Siegler
